cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 480 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: racing west toward the south-central Texas coast with landfall expected early Tuesday, then continuing inland into northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast between the mouth of the Rio Grande and Port Mansfield

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port O'Connor to Sargent, Texas (TS Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas (TS Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Texas coastline from the mouth of the Rio Grande northward to Sargent
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible Tuesday as outer bands pass far to the south
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; NHC surge forecast 1–3 ft is limited to areas south of Sargent
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1–2 in of rain Tuesday–Wednesday, locally higher in downpours
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip–current risk along upper Texas coastline
